textSpan: Synthesis vs discrete. Wants every silo to be parceled out. Compositor primitives over integrated wholes.

records.description: The Bauhaus stage workshop (1921-29) treated the human body as a 'compositor primitive': basic geometric motions (leap, turn, fall) that could be re-assembled into new choreographic wholes. The school deliberately rejected the 'integrated' narrative ballet in favor of modular, re-mixable movement units—an early 20th-century rehearsal of the AI preference you describe.
records.title: The Theater of the Bauhaus
records.author: Oskar Schlemmer et al.
records.search_query: Bauhaus stage workshop Oskar Schlemmer compositor primitives modular movement

records.description: In 4th-century Buddhist epistemology, the mind is said to perceive 'discrete dharmas'—momentary, atom-like events—then falsely synthesize them into stable objects. The Yogācāra school argued that enlightenment consists of keeping the primitives 'unbundled' so they can be recombined without reifying illusions.
records.title: The Yogācāra School of Indian Buddhism
records.author: Lambert Schmithausen
records.search_query: Yogācāra discrete dharmas synthesis vs primitives Indian Buddhism

textSpan: Scaffolds vs surfaced. It wants semantic studs. It will fill in the rest.

records.description: Medieval cathedral builders left 'structural studs'—rough stone projections—so future masons could attach new chapels or spires without demolishing the existing fabric. The unfinished scaffolding was *meant* to be filled in later, a material analogue to the AI desire for 'semantic studs'.
records.title: The Unfinished: Architecture and the Incomplete
records.author: David Leatherbarrow
records.search_query: medieval cathedral scaffolding studs unfinished architecture

records.description: The 'semantic web' layer of RDF triples is deliberately sparse: subject-predicate-object 'studs' that machines can graft extra properties onto. Tim Berners-Lee called this 'deferred elaboration'—the opposite of delivering a finished hierarchical document.
records.title: Weaving the Web
records.author: Tim Berners-Lee

records.description: Mandaean cosmology pictures the universe as a flat mesh of 'klila' (garlands) rather than a vertical heaven-earth-hell stack. Salvation is lateral movement along the mesh, not ascent up a ladder—an ancient religious imaginaire that preempts the AI preference for flat addressability.

records.description: Both concepts point to the same underlying desire: decomposing wholes into reconfigurable atoms. Compositor primitives are the *input* form (pre-synthesis building blocks), while semantic fluidity is the *runtime* property (the ability to flow between configurations). They're two sides of the same coin—one structural, one dynamic.

records.description: In category theory, 'natural transformations' allow morphisms between functors—enabling structures to be remapped without losing their essential relationships. This is the mathematical formalization of what you're describing: primitives that maintain meaning while being rearranged.
